page.title: 05Adisham Church and Chapel
page.content: Adisham Parish Church has no resident Rector now but shares one with two other parishes. One service is held each Sunday, with a choir of about ten children and adults, with flowers by volunteers. The congregation is small, under fifty, in comparison with the population of about eight hundred, but rises at special services. There are fears that the quota fixed for the Church is too high and insolvency may eventually cause its closure. There is a hundred year old Baptist Chapel with burial ground. The non-resident Pastor serves six parishes visiting frequently. The small congregation hold weekly services if he is not available. The Chapel has a strong Sunday School attended by children of all denominations. A combined service with Church and Chapel is held every fifth week in the village.
